body_html:
@goldsborough @apaszke The full test name <test module>.<test class>.<test name> gets passed as parameter to python -m unittest <full_test_name>. <full_test_name> can be any of the following formats:

python -m unittest test_module
python -m unittest test_module.TestClass
python -m unittest test_module.TestClass.test_method

The -i/--include parameter follows the above format and passes it to python -m unittest directly with only adding the test_ prefix in front of the test module. Then the unittest framework filters the tests.
body_text:
@goldsborough @apaszke The full test name <test module>.<test class>.<test name> gets passed as parameter to python -m unittest <full_test_name>. <full_test_name> can be any of the following formats:
python -m unittest test_module
python -m unittest test_module.TestClass
python -m unittest test_module.TestClass.test_method

The -i/--include parameter follows the above format and passes it to python -m unittest directly with only adding the test_ prefix in front of the test module. Then the unittest framework filters the tests.
body:
@goldsborough @apaszke The full test name ``<test module>.<test class>.<test name>`` gets passed as parameter to ``python -m unittest <full_test_name>``. ``<full_test_name>`` can be any of the following formats:
```
python -m unittest test_module
python -m unittest test_module.TestClass
python -m unittest test_module.TestClass.test_method
```
The **-i/--include** parameter follows the above format and passes it to ``python -m unittest`` directly with only adding the ``test_`` prefix in front of the test module. Then the unittest framework filters the tests.
